text: Tesfaye Tola (born October 19, 1974) is an Ethiopian long-distance runner, most known for winning a bronze medal in marathon at the 2000 Summer Olympics. The next year he finished fourth at the 2001 World Championships, and fifth in the World Half Marathon Championships. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2000 |Olympic Games |Sydney, Australia |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Marathon |2:11:10 |- |2007 |World Championships |Osaka, Japan |-- |Marathon |DNF |} He won the IAAF World Cross Country Championships in 1998 ==Personal bests== *10,000 metres - 28:12.32 (1999) *15 kilometres - 43:13 (2001) *Half marathon - 59:51 (2000) *Marathon - 2:06:57 (1999) ==References== * Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Ethiopian male marathon runners Category:Ethiopian male long-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Ethiopia Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Ethiopia Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Ethiopia Category:Olympic bronze medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Medalists at the 2000 Summer Olympics
title: Tesfaye Tola
